Recipe.title: Rice
Recipe.Description:
It wasn't until my mission that I found out how much of a difference there is between Minute Rice, and real Rice. In Puerto Rico, nobody uses Minute Rice because its taste and consistency are terrible compared to the real stuff.
Rice is cheap, can be stored for years and years before it is cooked, and it's a great, generic side dish.

section.instruction: In a saucepan with a lid, combine all ingredients.
Reduce heat to medium low and let simmer for about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir, and fluff up.

Notes.note: The lid needs to stay in place to keep heat and moisture mostly contained.
The slower the Rice simmers, the better. If you do it too hot, the rice at the bottom will burn.
Do not stir Rice while it is cooking.

Modifications.modification: You can substitute 1 Tablespoon of Butter for the Vegetable Oil.

If you have a Rice Cooker, replace steps with:
Throw everything in Rice Cooker and turn it on.
When it says it is done, stir and fluff up.
